daplot 0.0.1
  • Reference

Create a dual axis plot using ggplot2

daplot.Rd

Creates a ggplot2 plot with two y axes. The second y axis is scaled to match the range of the first y axis.

Usage

daplot(
  dat,
  x_col,
  y1,
  y2,
  y1_label = NULL,
  y2_label = NULL,
  y1_geom = ggplot2::geom_line,
  y2_geom = NULL,
  silent = TRUE,
  ...
)

Arguments

dat

input data frame

x_col

a column name in dat for x axis.

y1

a column name in dat for y1 axis.

y2

a column name in dat for y2 axis.

y1_label

an optional label for y1 axis. The column name for y1 is used if not provided.

y2_label

an optional label for y2 axis. The column name for y2 is used if not provided.

y1_geom

a ggplot2 geom function for y1 axis. Default is ggplot2::geom_line.

y2_geom

a ggplot2 geom function for y2 axis. Default is NULL, which uses the same geom as y1_geom.

silent

logical, if TRUE suppresses warnings during plot creation. Default is TRUE.

...

additional arguments passed to the geom functions.

Value

returns a ggplot object

Examples

mtcars |> daplot(mpg, wt, qsec)
